General Corrosion.unacceptable:
1. Prevent corrosion through adjusting the index by 
a. Reducing the saturation pH (e.g. by increasing alkalinity) or 
b. By increasing the pH (through alkali addition), or 
c. By increasing CaCO3 concentration by concentrating the stream  (through evaporation or reverse osmosis) and adjusting pH, or by adding calcium or alkalinity or both.
2. Combat corrosion by employing corrosion inhibitors.
3. Tolerate corrosive conditions by changing construction material.
General Corrosion.acceptable: Maintain monitoring, and be ready to take action should index increase.

General Corrosion.unacceptable:
1. Prevent scaling through adjusting the index by 
a. Increasing the saturation pH (e.g. by reducing alkalinity) or 
b. Decreasing the pH (through acid addition), or 
c. Decreasing CaCO3 concentration by diluting the stream  (through reducing concentration cycles, if applicable) and adjusting pH, or by removing calcium (softening - chemical, ion exchange or nano-filtration) or alkalinity (de-alkalation through acidification, chemical porecipitation, nono-filtration) or both.
2. Combat scaling by employing scale inhibitors.

Sulphate Concentration.tolerable:
1. Prevent corrosion through adjusting the index by reducing the concentrations of SO4 
2. Change construction material.
SO4 can be reduced through Chemical Precipitation (e.g. as SrSO4, BaSO4, CaSO4), Nanofiltration, Ion Exchange, Reverse Osmosis - partial stream or full stream.
